channel.title: mininet on Peyton Walters
channel.description: Recent content in mininet on Peyton Walters

item.title: Mininet for Education
item.description: For about 2 years, I built and led the NEAT Rack Project, a program meant to teach high school and college aged students network engineering. In this program, we covered things as basic as introduction to Linux and as advanced as firewalling or dynamic routing with BGP. This program was well-run, well-written, and it overall did a solid job of giving students an introduction to technology infrastructure. There was just one problem with it - hardware.
